snippet: A comment by Francis regarding a Chilean bishop accused of being complicit in clerical sexual abuse has raised doubts about the pope’s commitment to protecting victims.
abstract: Many doubt Pope Francis’s commitment to safeguard sexual abuse victims after video shows him calling protesters in Osorno, Chile, ‘dumb’ for denouncing Bishop Juan Barros, who is suspected of covering up sexual crimes allegedly committed by Santiago priest Fernando Karadima; pope’s comments anger demonstrators seeking to get Barros removed as diocese’s leader.
lead_paragraph: A comment by Francis regarding a Chilean bishop accused of being complicit in clerical sexual abuse has raised doubts about the pope’s commitment to protecting victims.

headline.main: Calling Protesters in Chile ‘Dumb,’ Pope Francis Sets Off Uproar
headline.print_headline: Video of Pope Raises Questions on Commitment to Protecting Abuse Victims

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith
